subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China ({{w|Traditional Chinese|traditional form}} based on {{w|Xin Zixing}}, {{w2|zh|新字形}}) and Japanese {{w|kanji}}, the left component is <big>{{l|mul|兹}}</big>, which is also the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In Taiwan and Hong Kong (based on the {{w|Big5}} character form for {{w|traditional Chinese}}) and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the left component is <font size=4, lang=zh-hant>[[茲#Translingual|茲]]</font> (contains <font size=4, lang=zh-hant>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font>, grass radical with 4 strokes).
